articles.title: Cipla surprises with strong earnings; L&T, BHEL ride on infra boom, says Anand Rathi‚Äôs Narendra Solanki
articles.content: Listen to this article in summarized format Listen Loading... √ó √ó Subscribe to Unlock AI Briefing and Premium Content Subscribe Now What's Included Exclusive Stories Daily ePaper Access Smart Market Tools Curated Investment Ideas Ad-lite Experience Subscription ETMarkets.com Narendra Solanki , Head of Fundamental Research at Anand Rathi Shares , says infrastructure and construction stocks like L&T and BHEL remain strong bets amid rising government spending, while Cipla ‚Äôs results beat expectations despite management changes. However, Dr Reddy‚Äôs faces a key setback after regulatory hurdles delay a major drug launch. Cipla‚Äôs earnings beat estimates, but leadership change raises eyebrows Cipla reported better-than-expected quarterly results, driven by stronger revenue growth, says Narendra Solanki, Head of Fundamental Research at Anand Rathi Shares. ‚ÄúNumbers were better than expected ‚Äî both on revenue and profit. The surprise, however, came from the sudden change in leadership,‚Äù he told ET Now. While the outgoing CEO was due for retirement next year, the timing of the announcement caught the market off guard. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôll have to wait and watch how the new management executes and what strategic changes they bring in,‚Äù Solanki added. Live Events You Might Also Like: Earnings recovery ahead: Quantum AMC‚Äôs Christy Mathai bets on banking, logistics, and pharma Despite the transition, the fundamental story remains intact, supported by steady margins and healthy US generics performance . L&T and BHEL: Strong order books, infrastructure tailwinds Solanki remains bullish on infrastructure and capital goods, particularly Larsen & Toubro (L&T) and BHEL, which have both posted solid earnings this quarter. ‚ÄúGovernment-led infrastructure spending continues to accelerate. Order awarding activity has picked up meaningfully compared to the first half of the year,‚Äù he said. He expects further momentum in the second half of FY26 as capital expenditure programs ramp up. ‚ÄúMacro fundamentals are improving, and we‚Äôre optimistic that the infrastructure theme will remain a strong structural play,‚Äù Solanki noted. You Might Also Like: Infra revival, metal rally, and pharma strength to drive next leg of market gains, says Anshul Saigal L&T‚Äôs record order book and execution strength, along with BHEL‚Äôs revival driven by energy transition projects, position them well for medium- to long-term growth, he added. Dr Reddy‚Äôs faces setback on GLP-1 opportunity Shares of Dr Reddy‚Äôs Laboratories fell nearly 4% after its much-anticipated GLP-1 drug launch faced regulatory hurdles in Canada. Solanki termed it a ‚Äúmajor setback‚Äù for the pharma major. ‚ÄúThe GLP-1 opportunity was expected to be a game-changer. The market had priced in at least a $100 million contribution by FY27,‚Äù he explained. With patent expiry approaching in early 2026, any delay could allow competitors to gain first-mover advantage. ‚ÄúIf you‚Äôre not first to market post-patent expiry, you lose pricing power and market share rapidly,‚Äù Solanki cautioned. You Might Also Like: Indian pharma & healthcare sector saw $3.5 bn deals in Q3 2025: Grant Thornton Bharat He emphasized that investors should monitor how quickly the company resolves regulatory observations to recover lost ground. Market outlook: Macro stable, stock selection key Solanki remains constructive on India‚Äôs macro outlook, citing rising public capex, a stable rupee, and moderating inflation. ‚ÄúMarkets are seeing sectoral churn, but the underlying fundamentals remain healthy. Investors should focus on stock-specific stories with earnings visibility,‚Äù he said. Add as a Reliable and Trusted News Source Add Now!
